intro: Rogiera oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxacan rogeria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a compact, shrub-like structure. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Rogiera oaxacensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its high-altitude environment.
